medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced acute-onset back pain yesterday afternoon, which continued through the night. This morning, the discomfort localized to the right lower quadrant/flank. The patient also began experiencing mild nausea, but no vomiting. No fever or chills noted, with normal bowel movements and appetite.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic lower back pain with multiple surgical interventions, asthma, hypertension, neuropathy in bilateral legs and arms, GERD, recent weight loss.
